intro: Cremanthodium sagittifolium, commonly known as the arrowleaf cremanthodium, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are arrow-shaped, giving it a distinctive appearance, and it produces small, yellowish flowers. Cremanthodium sagittifolium is often found in the Andes and is valued for its ecological role in alpine ecosystems.
